article.title: Shaping Epigenetic Memory via Genomic Bookmarking

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE about the polymer model depicted in Figure S1?
choices: Each bead in the polymer represents a single histone protein.
The colors of the beads represent the physical compaction state of the chromatin.
The model incorporates the binding of specific transcription factors to DNA.
The model aims to capture the dynamic nature of epigenetic marks on chromatin.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the first-order transition line (thick black line) in the phase diagram (Figure S2A) indicate about the system?
choices: The transition between swollen-disordered and compact-ordered phases is smooth and reversible.
The compact-ordered phase is highly susceptible to perturbations and easily transitions to other states.
The system exhibits hysteresis, meaning the transition between states depends on the system\'s history.
The swollen-ordered and compact-disordered phases are the most stable and common states.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure S3 demonstrates the impact of Genomic Bookmarking (GBM) on chromatin organization.  Which bookmark distribution pattern leads to the formation of distinct A/B compartments?
choices: Mixed GBM pattern
Random GBM pattern
Clustered GBM pattern
None of the above

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure S4 explores the relationship between bookmark density and domain formation. What is the key finding?
choices: Stable domains can form regardless of bookmark density.
A critical density of like-colored bookmarks is required to establish stable domains.
Increasing bookmark density beyond the critical threshold hinders domain formation.
Domain size is directly proportional to bookmark density.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure S5 illustrates the impact of bookmark excision and DNA replication on epigenetic patterns.  What happens to the established pattern when asymmetric interactions favor the blue mark, and bookmark excision occurs?
choices: The red domain remains stable despite bookmark excision.
Bookmark excision has no effect on the established epigenetic pattern.
Bookmark excision eventually leads to the loss of the red domain as blue marks take over.
DNA replication, not bookmark excision, destabilizes the epigenetic pattern.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure S6 validates the model by comparing it to experimental data from Drosophila S2 cells. What does the comparison between in silico and in vivo ChIP-seq data for H3K27me3 reveal?
choices: The model successfully predicts the distribution of H3K27me3 marks based on PSC bookmark locations, showing a strong correlation with experimental data.
The model fails to accurately predict the distribution of H3K27me3 marks, suggesting additional factors are involved.
The model predicts that all bookmarked segments will be populated by Polycomb marks, contradicting experimental observations.
The model highlights that 3D chromatin conformation has no influence on H3K27me3 spreading.
